etymology.description: 會意 / 会意: 廾 (two hands) + 口 (an object) – holding up an object with two hands.
etymology.interpretation: 共 depicts the image of two hands (廾) holding an object (originally represented by 口). The imagery emphasizes the concept of holding something jointly, reflecting the meaning of 'together.' Over time, the representation of the object transformed, leading to the modern form of 共.

examples.chinese: 我们一起工作(我們一起工作)。
共鸣(共鳴)是非常重要的。
这是一项共同的任务(這是一項共同的任務)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shì yī xiàng gòngtóng de rènwù.
